activities.title: Problem Discovery
activities.subtitle: Video Workshop + Pair Activity
activities.details: This workshop explores the first step towards product development process with product leader and entrepreneur Alan Albert. It focuses on problem identification, bias, and customer analysis.
steps: Watch the 45-minute video workshop, from 03:49 to 48:00. There's a lot of content, so don't forget to take notes!
Pair up with another participant (from your team or Discord) and complete the workshop activity. Watch the 3-minute introduction to the activity from 48:00 to 51:00.

Reflect on what you learned and share your interviewing experience in the #share-your-work channel in Discord.
Each time you share your work or write a meaningful comment about another group's work (max. 3 per module), you're entered into a prize draw for a $25 gift card. The winner will be announced at the end of Bootcamp week!
Congratulations! You've completed this activity. Join us in Discord at 8:00 PM PDT for a Kahoot Quiz: 1st place wins a $25 gift card!

activities.title: Feature Prioritization Pt. 1
activities.subtitle: Video Workshop
activities.details: How do you prioritize product features and solutions? This video workshop will guide you through the process of prioritizing features for your product. It culminates with a real-life case study provided by Rise People in Pt. 2.
steps: Watch 40-minute video workshop, from 14:47 to 56:52. There's a lot of content, so don't forget to take notes!
Begin working through steps 1–3 of Feature Prioritization Pt. 2 in preparation for tomorrow's activity if you have time.
Congratulations! You've completed this activity. Get ready for a Kahoot Quiz on what you learned tomorrow!

activities.title: Feature Prioritization Pt. 2
activities.subtitle: Group Activity
activities.details: This live activity is a continuation of yesterday's video workshop on Feature Prioritization. It includes a real-life case study provided by Rise People.
steps: Watch the 14-minute introduction video to the case study, from 57:00 to 110:45.
Open this case document and read through the case information. (~10 min)

Find a group of at least 2-4 people to work through the task together. Ask your Produthon teammates to join you. Or, if you don't have a team yet, use the #find-a-partner channel in the Bootcamp section of Discord.
With your group, open this Google Slides template (link coming soon) to work through the feature prioritization process. (~30 min)

Share a PDF copy of your slides in the #share-your-work channel in Discord. And comment on another group's work!
Each time you share your work or write a meaningful comment about another group's work (max. 3 per module), you're entered into a prize draw for a $25 gift card. The winner will be announced at the end of Bootcamp week!
Congratulations! You've completed this activity. Join us in Discord at 8:00 PM PDT for a Kahoot Quiz: 1st place wins a $25 gift card!

activities.title: Product Validation
activities.subtitle: Live Workshop
activities.details: Wrap up your product development process by learning various tools and techniques to validate and find metrics for your product, then tackle a live case with feedback from Scott Baldwin, a Product Management leader from Productboard.
steps: Register for the event to receive the Zoom link.
Join us on Zoom from 6:30 – 8:00 PM PDT for the live workshop. There's a lot of content, so don't forget to take notes!
Congratulations! You've completed this activity. Get ready for a Kahoot Quiz on what you learned tomorrow!

activities.title: Team Formation
activities.subtitle: Live Networking
activities.details: Don't have a team yet? Attend this networking social to meet competitors with complementary skills and form a team of 3-4 together!
steps: Join us in Discord from 7:00 – 8:00 PM PDT to find some teammates. Turning on your video camera is encouraged.

Join us in Discord at 8:00 PM PDT for a final Kahoot Quiz: 1st place wins a $25 gift card!
This will be based on yesterday's Product Validation content and all of the PM strategies you've learned during Bootcamp week.

Congratulations! You've completed this activity, which concludes Bootcamp. We hope you're able to apply your learnings from these workshops during the Produthon weekend—and in all your future product creations!
